title: WHY DID YOU BUFF XIN
body:
his kit is ridiculously toxic, he jumps the adc then slaps them to death. No skill required and free crits and heals. WHY DID YOU BUFF HIM???
Just played a game with one and had him go 13/3 and 2 shot everyone on our team. FUCK YOU BALANCE TEAM

Xin isn't the issue. The issue is rageblade. A lot of people can duel him. Trynd yi jax udyr etc. Before the buffs xin couldn't duel anyone unless he was ahead. Now he can. That doesn't mean he is op. He goes squish, has no escape, and his gap closer is on a 12 second cooldown. If you let him get to your backline then they will die. If you let trynd get to your backline they will die. If you let any bruiser or dueler get to your backline they will die. Get over it. At least xin can't escape after like trynd yi fizz zed lb etc.

No.  Xin Zhao has always been an issue.  Ever since release, he has caused problems.

Riot said in the patch notes that he has been stuck in an under-performing place for a while.  They seem to have somehow forgot that they themselves deliberately put him there.
I'm starting to feel that Riot is like Comgress: there's a new cabinet coming in every so often to makr the same mistakes over and over.
It's more that they're too proud to ever admit that they were wrong, so they fail to even see their mistakes as mistakes and insist that they were somehow right all along.

"Y-yeah, ruining Cassiopeia and Mordekaiser was all 'part of the plan.' Xin needs to be stronger because this meta doesn't feel worth balancing. Boop."

He's still ridiculously toxic to play against. Yes, at higher elos where you have teammates who know that peeling is a thing he will perform worse, but holy shit, a jump from 43% to 47% in 2 days is still an incredible shift in power. This is especially true when considering 12% of the people are picking him, meaning is should have a winrate below 50% since a lot of them are probably first-timers playing a FoTM Champ.

Another thing to consider is that he's probably being banned a lot, meaning if he's ever available to pick, some non-Xin player will probably take him despite not knowing a thing about him, resulting in a pretty poor performance.

All these champions have an immobilizing effect of some kind; they can keep a person in one place while an ally runs or displace them from that ally. That is not to say that they are all equally able to peel for their allies. Leona is brain dead easy. Brand has a lot of limitations on his. The point is that he _can_ do it just like Illaoi has no immobilizing cc in her kit whatsoever and therefore_can't_ do it no matter how good you are with her. I count 93 champion. That's more than half the roster.

I never said Xin was balanced. I'm just saying there are a lot of champions who can contribute to peel even if they aren't good at it. And soraka's is actually very easy. Just lay the E around the carry. If the bruiser or assassin tries to jump them, they can't cast, can't flash, and are usually rooted.
